intro: Ceramocarpium polyanthes, commonly known as the golden star, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain the seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
